listener
Class Action

java.lang.Object
  listener.Action

public abstract class Action
extends java.lang.Object

Actions class defines which types of Sprites have an associated action. Essentially, the Listener class has a series of these for two types of sprites, such as a 'Rock' Sprite and a 'Monster' Sprite. When a Sprite wants to commit an action, the Listener looks to see which types of Actions it has. If it has an action with the correct types, then the action is performed.

Author:
Fluxware

Constructor Detail

Action

public Action()
Default Action with both Sprites being 'null'. This is a generally useless creation of an Action class, and is generally only used for testing purposes.

Action

public Action(Sprite primary,
              Sprite secondary)
Creates an action with the two Sprites. These two Sprites are the types used for comparison. These sprites are not needed and are only used to determine the class type.

Parameters:
primary - - The First Sprite used in the comparison.
secondary - - The second Sprite used in the comparison.
Method Detail

action

public abstract void action(Sprite primary,
                            Sprite secondary)
Details what should occur when the Sprite of type primary and a sprite of type secondary interact.

Parameters:
primary - - The first Sprite that will have actions applied to it.
secondary - - The second Sprite that will have actions applied to it.

matches

public boolean matches(Sprite one,
                       Sprite two)
Matches two Sprites to see if they are of the same type.

Parameters:
one - - The first Sprite to be compared.
two - - The second Sprite to be compared.
Returns:
- True is the Sprite types match, false if otherwise.
